MemoryInfobox.name: A Midsummer Nightmare
MemoryInfobox.description: 'A writer, enraged that a drunken actor had ruined her play, vowed to get revenge either on the man himself, or on his goats.'

General_Description: '''A Midsummer Nightmare''' was a virtual representation of one of [[Kassandra]]'s genetic memories, relived by [[Layla Hassan]] through the Portable [[Animus|Animus HR-8.5]].
Section_Description: Kassandra met an incensed writer, who had a job for her.
Section_Dialogue:
Kassandra noticed a job posted on a [[message board]]. *'''Note:'''
''Anyone willing to help me teach a wretched ''malákas'' a lesson, let's talk!'' She sought out the writer and addressed her. *'''Kassandra:''' ''You left a message on the board. What’s the matter?'' *'''Woman:''' ''My play was a disaster, ''misthios''! The actor was drunk, the ''malákas''! He ruined it!'' *'''Kassandra:''' ''What did he do?'' *'''Woman:''' ''What didn't he do? Stumbling around, slurring the lines he didn't forget - he even spewed vomit on the front row! I was a fool to think an idiot [[goat]]herd could be an actor, but I'll have my revenge.'' *'''Kassandra:''' ''And let me guess, you want me to kill him.'' *'''Woman:''' ''His blood must be spilled.'' (Accept - I'll handle it.) *'''Kassandra:''' ''I'm in.''
Section_Outcome: Kassandra helped the writer and was rewarded for this.
Section_Trivia: *The name of the memory references ''{{Wiki|A Midsummer Night's Dream}}'', a play by [[William Shakespeare]].

*''[[Assassin's Creed: Odyssey]]''
